Hi Kent,

I don't know if anyone else has noticed this, but the latest JUnit 
from CVS is broken.  A test I'd just written and expected to fail 
didn't.  On 11 Sep 2004 you made a change to TestCase:

TestCase.java 1.15
"Make sure an exception thrown during tearDown() doesn't mask an
exception thrown during running the test. I don't much like the 
TestCase.runBare()
code but I can't see how to simplify it. It was so much simpler 
before. Sniff..."

While the code now makes sure that if tearDown() throws an exection 
after runTest() has thrown one, the exception from the test takes 
preference.  Unfortunately, if tearDown() DOESN'T throw an exception 
the exception from runTest() is completely masked!!  Local 
variable 'running' needs to be checked at the end of the method to 
throw any exception on normal exit!

How can this be I asked?  Surely JUnit's own unit tests would have a 
check for something as simple as a test not failing when it should?  
Then I realised, of course, if it's using the same version of 
TestCase, the failure will never be seen!

Obviously not enough people who are using the CVS version are 
checking that their tests fail when they should ;-)!

Cheers,

Andrew
